results.title: Double thread
results.creator_credit: Mary Field and G R Instruction
results.brief_description: How the daily routine is organised for the children’s own needs in a modern well-equipped nursery school in England. Every activity is designed to help the individual child’s development, and to encourage their adjustment to social and group relationships. The “double thread” refers to the inter-relations of home and kindergarten in the growing child’s life.

results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.

results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers III”.
Dorothy Hewett reflects on her life as a playwright, poet, author and teacher. Hewett grew up in Western Australia and has been a writer all her life. A political, social and sexual rebel, she has created work which has often been controversial for its frankness and for the power of her female central characters. In this 1991 interview, Hewett discusses the professional and personal relationships that have enriched her life and inspired her writing. She also speaks about ageing and her struggle to overcome the loss of physical power. Research and interview: James Murdoch.

results.title: Dorothea [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Wendy Chandler, Anna Grieve and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A young Greek woman, Dorothea, escapes her family’s resistance to adopting new ways and an arranged marriage by becoming involved in a theatre group and falling for the lead performer. Cast includes Helen Dullas, William Dye and Saavas Panas.

results.title: Don Quixote
results.brief_description: Outlandishly loopy cartoon from this pioneering american animator. Quixote’s world is transfigured by his own unchecked imagination - he navigates an enchanted vista of fairy-tale cliches. Whimsical questing for gallant ideals ends in fevered retreat to the sanctuary of Ye Olde Bughouse. Disarmingly innocent and frenetically paced, this is among Iwerk’s best works.

results.title: Don't start off with an accident
results.creator_credit: Stan Murdoch, Reg Perier, New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry and Perier Films
results.brief_description: Starts with a young recruit to a production factory who has a minor accident with equipment. Shows the many dangers with improper equipment handling and the importance of safety training. Expands to cover safety aspects of other industries, particularly building.

results.title: Don't shoot the writer
results.brief_description: An excellent documentary on the evolution of the Australian film and television industry. By interviewing screenwriters such as David Williamson, Eleanor Whitcombe (My Brilliant Career) and Roger Simpson (Sword of Honour) we are given an insight into the struggles in the late 60’s and 70’s to develop an Australian film culture; on the formation of the Australian Writers Guild to help encourage writing for the screen; and the struggle to see their visions realised on television and the cinema.
